question: What is the number of disaster projects starting later than 2021?
sub_query: Starting date of disaster projects after 2021
final_answer:
The number of disaster projects starting later than 2021 is currently unknown as there are no disaster projects currently under construction. However, there are several disaster projects with starting dates after 2021. These projects include the Citywide Guardrail Replacement project, Westward Beach Road Shoulder Repairs project, and the Outdoor Warning Sirens project. The starting dates for these projects are as follows:

- Citywide Guardrail Replacement: Design to be completed by Spring 2022, construction to begin in Fall 2022.
- Westward Beach Road Shoulder Repairs: Design to be completed by July 2022, construction to begin in Fall 2022.
- Outdoor Warning Sirens - Design (FEMA Project): Final design to be completed in Spring 2022, construction to begin in Spring/Summer 2022.

Therefore, while the specific number of disaster projects starting later than 2021 is not provided, these are some of the projects with starting dates scheduled after 2021.
sub_answers: At this time, there are no disaster projects under construction. The report focused on the status of both Capital Improvement Projects and Disaster Recovery Projects.

(cid:190) Project Description: An Emergency Warning Siren system will improve the

infrastructure requirements, and siren sound range. The City has been

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing fire damaged existing

Corral Canyon Culvert Repairs (FEMA Project)

Clover Heights Storm Drain (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of design and construction of a few
storm drains on Clover Heights. The existing storm drain facility ends at the
intersection of Clover Heights and Harvester Road. During storms, this
intersection floods and causes debris to block the road. An extended storm
drain towards the end of Clover Heights will help eliminate this issue.

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Staff is currently preparing consultant proposals for the design of this

project. Proposals will be due in February/March.

Latigo Canyon Road Culvert Repairs (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of repairing the existing storm drain
on Latigo Canyon Road located approximately 2,500 feet from PCH that was
damaged by the Woolsey Fire.

Disaster Projects (Completed)

Citywide Guardrail Replacement
Project Description: This project consisted of replacing the damaged guardrails throughout
the City caused by the Woolsey Fire on Encinal Canyon Road, Corral Canyon Road, and
Kanan Dume Road. The project was combined with the County of Los Angeles’ damaged
guardrails. The project was completed in February 2021.

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The City has hired a consultant to design this project. The design has

started and is anticipated to be completed by the Spring of 2022.
